seo.title: Web3 Audit Competitions and Bug Bounties
seo.description: Hats.Finance is a decentralized smart bug bounty and audit competitions marketplace. Permissionless, scalable, and allows anyone to provide liquidity.
seo.createNewVaultTitle: Create new Audit Competition/Bug Bounty vault

translation.invalid-username:
Invalid username (only letters, numbers, _ and .)
Don't finish with symbols.
translation.github-username-not-valid: This GitHub username does not exist
translation.should-not-be-url: Please, do not enter a URL
translation.at-least-one-email: At least one email is required
translation.not-github-url: This is not a GitHub URL
translation.address-is-not-token: The address is not a token
translation.endtimeGreaterThanStarttime: End time must be greater than start time
translation.not-safe-address: Not a multisig address (check address or network)
translation.not-enough-safe-members: Not enough members (minimum is {{min}} and now is only {{now}})
translation.not-enough-safe-signers: Not enough multisig signers (minimum is {{min}} and now is only {{now}})
translation.at-least-one-pgp-key-required: At least one PGP key is required
translation.key-is-public-not-private: This key is a public key, you need a private key
translation.key-is-private-not-public: This key is a private key, you need a public key
translation.pleaseConfirmTransaction: Please confirm the transaction in your wallet
translation.weAreProcessingWithdrawRequest: We are processing your withdrawal request. In a couple of seconds you will see the status of your request.
translation.safeProposalCreatedSuccessfully:
The Safe proposal was created successfully. Please continue the process on your Safe wallet. 

 You can go back here and click on the refresh button when the transaction is executed on-chain.
translation.safeProposalCreatedSuccessfullyWithoutGo: The Safe proposal was created successfully. Please continue the process on your Safe wallet.
translation.vulnerabilitySubmitted: Your report was successfully submitted to the committee!
translation.vaultEditorCommitteeMembersSafeExplanati:
Fill the information for each committee member and create PGP key-pair on Hats dedicated tool or any other trusted tool. Please be aware this information is only for the details of the vault, but all the members of the multisig will have access to all vault actions.
  • The PGP keys will permit decrypt submissions.
  • Share this page with committee members to generate their own set of keys.
  • Please be aware you can decrypt submissions on the browser you created the keys on. You can open as many keys as you wish on multiple browser & devices.
translation.vaultEditorCommitteeDetailsSafeExplanati:
Add Safe committee multi-sig address. Don't have a Safe? open one in the Safe web-app. The committee members of your vault will automatically be added in the next page. Committee requirements:
  • Minimum amount of committee members is 3.
  • The minimum amount of signers is 2.
translation.vaultEditorSeveritiesExplanation:
Edit the severities for the vault or use an existing vaults severities as a template.
  • The description of the severity level will serve as the primary criteria for determining whether the report aligns with this level of severity.
  • The severity pool reward (%) will indicate the allocated percentage from the whole vault. For audit competitions the sum of all the percentages among the severities should be 100%.
translation.vaultEditorContractsCoveredExplanation: Fill the information for each contract or asset covered. Add the address/URL of the asset and the possible severities.
translation.vaultEditorFinishedSetupExplanation:
You have finished filling out all the info needed for setting up the vault. 

 The info you have added will appear as the vault description on Hats dapp (email not included).
translation.vaultEditorFinishedEditionExplanation: You have finished editing the vault. Now you can send this form to governance for approval.
translation.vaultEditorCreateVaultOnChainExplanation: Fill the info in order to create a vault. Once done you will be requested to execute a transaction that will create a vault on-chain.
translation.vaultEditorMaxBountyExplanation: The 'Maximum bounty' will set the maximum percentage of the payable vault bounty. The maximum vault bounty allowed is 90%. (100% of the vault can't be payed within one bounty) Example: If a vault has 100K deposited and the maximum bounty is set to 90% in the case of a critical severity the maximum pay-out will be 90K. Set the maximum bounty (maximum 90%)
translation.vaultEditorBountySplitExplanation: The bounty split will set the way a bounty will split when a pay-out occurs. The control of the bounty split is divided between the committee of the vault (90% editable parameters) and Hats governance (10% non editable parameters). Set the committee controlled split parameters, the total should be 100%. Please note, when viewed on the dapp the percentage will appear as percentage of the whole vault.
translation.vaultEditorVaultPreviewExplanation: Preview your vault as it will appear on Hats dApp.
translation.vaultEditorFinalStepExplanation:
Create the vault by completing the on-chain transaction. 
 Once the transaction is executed, the vault is created on-chain 

 The vault description may be edited at any time, changes will require Hat governance approval.
translation.committeeMembersOutsideMultisigExplanati: You can add committee members who are not part of the Safe multisig. Please note, those committee members will not be permitted to sign on pay-outs or edit the vault. They can only decrypt vulnerabilities sent to the vault.
translation.emailsNotVerifiedExplanation: In order to create the vault you have to verify the email address. The following email/s wasn't verified.
translation.vaultEditorDefaultSeveritiesExplanation:
The following are list of severities linked to your vault, initally based on Hats template.
You can add or edit any of the severities.
translation.vaultEditorScopeExplanation: The scope will allow the user better understand your protocols needs and focus on the right areas.
translation.vaultBlockedBecauseIsCreated: This vault can't be edited because it's already created on-chain. This is read-only mode. If you want to edit it, please go to the status page and do it there.
translation.vaultBlockedBecauseIsPendingCreation: This vault can't be edited because it's pending creation on-chain. Please wait while we are creating the vault on-chain.
translation.doneEditingTheExistingVault: Done editing the vault? Click on 'Send to governance approval' and Hats team will be notified to review the changed and update your vault.
translation.youAreEditingAnExistingVault: You are editing an existing vault. When you are done editing the vault, you can send it to governance approval.
translation.offerDescriptionHowTheProtocolWorks: Offer an outline of how the protocol functions in practice
translation.setMaxBountyHelper: Set the maximum % of the vault allocated for bounties
translation.deployVaultHelper: Continue and fill-out the info needed for to deploy the vault on-chain
translation.editExistingVaultExplanation: Connect with a committee member wallet to edit an existing vault or view it's status.
translation.youNeedToConnectToAWallet: You need to be connected to your wallet
translation.followingStepsVaultStatus: In order for your vault to appear on Hats live dApp please finish the following steps.
translation.editVaultHelp: You can request a edition on your vault's description. After that, the governance team will approve your request and update your vault.
translation.checkInExpanation: Press check-in and sign a transaction with. This will create the TX proposal on committee multisig.
translation.depositOnVaultExplanation:
Deposit assets to the vaults. 

 Vault deposit is needed for the vault listing on Hats live dApp.
translation.yourVaultChangedExplanation: Your vault information has a new version. Please take a look at the changes and try again.
translation.someoneIsCreatingTheVault: Other committee member is creating the vault on-chain. You can't edit the vault form until the vault is created.
translation.pendingApprovalExplanation: Pending approval - Hats team is reviewing your submission.
translation.vautlLiveExplanation: Your vault is live on Hats dApp.
translation.connectWithMultisigOrCheckInOnGnosis: Connect with the committee multisig using WalletConnect or check-in directly via Safe app.
translation.connectWithCommitteeMultisig: You must be connected with the committee multisig using WalletConnect.
translation.connectWithCommitteeMember: You must be a vault committe member.
translation.connectWithCommitteeMultisigOrBeAMemberF: You must be a vault committe member in order to edit the vault.
translation.approveTheTransactionOnSafeApp: Approve the transaction on the Safe app.
translation.vaultWithoutDescriptionError: Your vault doesn't have a description. Wait couple of minutes. If the problem continue, please contact Hats support.
translation.youCantExecuteThisTxWithMultisig: You can't execute this transaction with the committee multisig. Please use your personal wallet.
translation.areYouSureYouWantToChangeBountySplit:
Are you sure you want to change the bounty split percentages? 

 * You will need to sign a transaction with your connected wallet.
translation.areYouSureYouWantToChangeMaxBounty:
Are you sure you want to change the maximum bounty percentage? 

 * You will need to sign a transaction with your connected wallet.
translation.areYouSureYouWantToChangeBothVaultParame:
Are you sure you want to change the bounty split and maximum bounty percentage? 

 * You will need to sign a transaction with your connected wallet.
translation.youCantEditBecauseIsPendingApproval: You can't edit this vault because it's pending for governance approval. In order to edit this vault you need to cancel the current request clicking in the button below.
translation.youCantEditBecauseIsStatus: You can't edit this vault because it's {{status}}. If you want to edit this vault, please go to the status page and request a new edition.
translation.youCantEditBecauseIsStatusShort: You can't edit this vault because it's {{status}}.
translation.existingEditSessionsHelperNoPendingAppro: These are the editions request you did to your vault. If you want to edit this vault, please click on the 'Edit vault' button below.
translation.existingEditSessionsHelperPendingApprova: These are the editions request you did to your vault. You have currently one edition waiting for approval, please wait until governance approve it or if you want you can cancel the approval request.
translation.vaultRepoInformationExplanation: Please put here all the code repositories where the code/contracts are.
translation.vaultRepoInformationExplanationAudit: Please put here the code repositoriy where the contracts are, along with the specific commit hash. This is used for creating a fork of the repo and creating issues for each security researcher submission. Also, we are going to show this information on the vault details page (as soon as the repo is public)
translation.vaultRepoInformationExplanationPrivateAu:
Please put here the code repositoriy where the contracts are, along with the specific commit hash. 

This is used for creating a fork of the repo and creating issues for each security researcher submission.
translation.youHaveNotSelectedRepos: You have not specified any repository information.
translation.youHaveNotSelectedAnyContracts: You have not specified any contract information.
translation.editSessionIsNotDirty: You haven't made any changes to the vault description.
translation.weWillNotifyYouWhenEditionIsApproved: We will notify you when the edition is approved
translation.areYouSureYouWantToEditThisVault: Are you sure you want to request governance to edit vault's information?
translation.areYouSureYouWantToRemoveThisMember: Are you sure you want to remove this member?
translation.areYouSureYouWantToRemoveThisPgpKey: Are you sure you want to remove this PGP Key?
translation.areYouSureYouWantToCancelApprovalRequest: Are you sure you want to cancel the approval request?
translation.thisVaultIsAlredyCreated: This vault is already created on-chain.
translation.weAreFinishingTheCreationOfVault:
Thanks for creating a new vault in Hats! 

 We are finishing the creation of your vault. We need a couple more minutes. 

 We will notify you via email you when the vault is created.
translation.executeTxOnGnosisForCreatingVault:
Thanks for creating a new vault in Hats! 

 You just create the proposal for creating the vault in Safe app. Please approve and execute the transaction on the Safe app. 

 We will notify you via email you when the vault is created.
translation.weRecommendToAddAtLeastTwoMembers: We recommend to add at least two members to your vault.
translation.immediateSplitExplanation: Funds sent immediately to beneficiary's wallet
translation.vestedSplitExplanation: Funds vested 30 days, then sent to beneficiary's wallet.
translation.hatsRewardSplitExplanation: Vested HATS reward (pending start of TGE)
translation.ifYouWantToConnectWalletConnect:
If you want to connect your multisig wallet with WalletConnect, follow these steps: 
 1. Open Safe WalletConnect app (pressing the button below). 
 2. Select 'WalletConnet' on the 'Connect Wallet' button. 
 3. Copy the QR code and paste it on Safe app.
translation.invalidPgpKeyPleaseSelectNewOne: Invalid PGP key, please select a new one
translation.enterMessageToDecrypt: Enter here the message you want to decrypt
translation.hereYouWillSeeDecryptedMessage: Here you will see the decrypted message
translation.youAreNotACommitteeMember: You are not a committee member.
translation.nextSafePeriodStartsAt: The next safe period will start at {{safetyPeriodDate}}
translation.safePeriodExplanation: Each {{withdrawDuration}} and for {{safetyDuration}} the committee gathers. During that time withdrawals are disabled.
translation.vaultPausedActiveClaimExplanation: Committee is paying out a reward, the vault is paused for withdrawals.
translation.vaultPausedActiveClaimExplanationLong: This vault is currently pause for withdrawals because committee is paying out a reward.
translation.title: Title
translation.cookiesExplanation: This website uses cookies to ensure you the best experience on our website.
translation.preparingPayoutCompetitionsExplanation: The competition has concluded, and we are now in the dispute resolution phase, preparing for the payout. Everything is expected to be finalized in the coming weeks.
translation.continuousAuditCompetitionExplanation: This project was previously audited. Now there is more code to be audited.
translation.noNftsGeneratedInfo: No NFTs generated yet. Click on 'Generate NFTs' to generate them.
translation.nftsRegenerateInfo:
NFTs already generated on a previous edit session of the vault and the logo has changed. 
Click on 'Regenerate NFTs' to regenerate them with the current version.
translation.generatingNftsInfo: Generating NFTs. This may take a few minutes.
translation.nftsGeneratedWithEditSessionId: NFTs generated with edit session ID
translation.continuousAuditWarning:
This project was previously audited. The committee added a new commit hash to be audited. The main focus of the competition is the new code (commit hash), but if some finding is found on the old code, it will be rewarded.

You can take a look at the diff between both commit hashes on the repos section.
translation.name: Name
translation.howToWithdrawExplanation: To initiate a withdrawal, kindly submit a withdrawal request. This request will enter a pending status for a period of 7 days. Once the 7-day period concludes, you will be able to proceed with the withdrawal for another 7 days.
translation.why7daysPeriods: Why do we have a 7 days waiting period?
translation.why7daysPeriodsExplanation: The reason behind the 7-day waiting period is to implement additional protective measures that help prevent Front-running payouts. We prioritize the security of our users and hence have implemented this precautionary measure.
translation.cantDepositBecauseCheckin: Committee is not checked-in. You can't deposit tokens.
translation.cantDepositBecausePause: This vault is not open for deposits. You can't deposit tokens.
translation.depositWillCancelWithdraw: Depositing tokens will cancel your withdraw request.
translation.safePeriodOnCantWithdraw: You can't withdraw tokens during the safe period.
translation.activeClaimCantWithdraw: You can't withdraw tokens while there is an active payout.
translation.intendedValueExplanation: This is the value the committee intends to deposit and reward.
translation.successDepositModalContent:
Your just deposited {{amount}} to the vault. 

 Thank you for supporting this project.
translation.successWithdrawModalContent: Your just withdraw {{amount}} from the vault.
translation.successWithdrawRequestModalContent:
Your withdraw request was submitted successfuly. 

 You will be able to withdraw your tokens in 7 days, during safety period.
translation.generateContractsBasedOnRepo: Generate contracts based on repo information
translation.wantsToSetDefaultValue: Do you want to set defaul value?
translation.wantsToSetDefaultValueExplanation: If you set the template value you will lose the current information
translation.wantsToGenerateContractsBasedOnRepo: Do you want to generate contracts?
translation.wantsToGenerateContractsBasedOnRepoExpla: We are going to generate contracts covered based on all the solidity files you have on the repository.
translation.contractsGeneratedExplanation: Were generated {{generated}} contracts covered based on the repositories.
translation.noContractsGeneratedExplanation: Your repository is not reachable (invalid/private repo) or there are no solidity files on the repository.
translation.vaultDoesNotHaveWaitingApprovalEditSessi: This vault does not have any pending edit session
translation.errorDuringSafeProposal: An error has occurred during the creation of the safe proposal.
translation.proposalCreatedSuccessfully: Safe transaction proposal was created successfully.
translation.youNeedToBeSignedInSiwe: You need to be signed in with Ethereum to use this tool
translation.youNeedToOpenYourPGPTool: You need to open your PGP tool
translation.submissionNotFound: Submission not found or you can't decrypt it. Please be sure you have the correct PGP key on the PGP Tool.
translation.dateIsInGMT: Date is in your local time (GMT{{timezone}})
translation.vaultEditorAssetInformation:
Choose the reward token.
 In order to maximize participation of security researcher we recommend the reward will be in stable coin.
translation.areYouSureYouWantToPublishAuditDraft: Are you sure you want to publish this audit draft?
translation.areYouSureYouWantToDeleteAuditDraft: Are you sure you want to delete this audit draft?
translation.doYouWantToGoToProjectWebsite:
Do you want to go to project website? 
 ({{website}})
translation.maxRewardCapExplanation: This is the maximum amount that will be paid for a single submission.
translation.clearSubmissionExplanation:
Are you sure you want to clear this submission? 

 This will remove all the information of the submission.
translation.clearExistingSubmissionAuditWizardExplan:
Attention, you have started to create a submission, in order to submit a new one from AuditWizard you need to remove the current one. 

Are you sure you want to clear this submission? 
 This will remove all the information of the submission.
translation.projectNotAvailableExplanation:
The project on which you are attempting to submit a vulnerability is no longer available. 

 If you think this is an error, please contact Hats support.
translation.thereIsNoPublicSubmission: There are no public submission for this vault yet.
translation.doYouWantToSeeSubmissionsOnGithub: Do you want to see the submissions on GitHub?
translation.submissionChangedExplanationAuditWizard:
The submission you are trying to edit has changed. 

 If you want to edit the submission, please go back to Audit Wizard.
translation.submissionNotValidExplanationAuditWizard:
The submission you are trying to edit is not valid. 

 Please go back to Audit Wizard and try again.
translation.scopePrivateAuditsWarning:
This is a private audit competition.
For this vault, all the scope information should be under the private github repository.
translation.privateAuditSubmissionsOnlyOnGithub:
This is a private audit competition. 
All the submissions should be on the private GitHub repository. You can go to the github clicking on the button below.
translation.pleaseSignInWithEthereumToSeePrivateComp: Please sign in with Ethereum (SIWE) to see private competitions.
translation.youAreNotInvitedToAnyPrivateComps: You are not invited to any private competitions.
translation.privateAuditSubmissionsScopeInGithub:
This is a private audit competition. 
All the scope information will be on the private GitHub repository. You can go to the github clicking on the button below.
translation.makeSureLastEditSessionIsApproved: Please make sure the last edit session is approved
translation.nftsBeingGeneratedPleaseWait: NFTs are being generated. Please wait couple of minutes if you want to edit the vault.

HackerProfile.welcomeTitle: Welcome to the White Hats Community!
HackerProfile.welcomeContent:
Greetings to all White Hat Hackers, Security Researchers, and Auditors! 

 New to Hats? No problem.
Join us now and start your hacking journey later.
HackerProfile.introTitle: Your wallet = Your White Hat profile
HackerProfile.introContent:
On Hats you submit vulnerabilities, get paid and arbitrate on-chain.

Create your White Hat prodile using your wallet.

  • List all your socials and add a short bio.
  • Track your stats.
  • Explore your audit competition history and OnChain discoveries in a detailed timeline view.
HackerProfile.usernameIntro: Choose a nickname that represents you.
HackerProfile.titleIntro: Describe yourself in a title, like "White hat hacker" (max. 120 characters)
HackerProfile.title: Title
HackerProfile.bioIntro: Share a glimpse of who you are with other white hat hackers and protocols. Write a short bio highlighting your background, achievements, and unique strengths (max. 300 characters).
HackerProfile.socialsIntro: Link your social media accounts. Your Twitter (X) account will be used to tag you on your winnings!
HackerProfile.avatarIntro: Upload a profile image that will be showcased publicly.
HackerProfile.avatarGithubProdileImageExplanation: Please note: If you add your GitHub username, we'll use your GitHub profile picture. Otherwise, a unique auto-generated image will be assigned.
HackerProfile.profileNotFoundError: Profile not found. Please go back to dApp.
HackerProfile.deleteProfileDescription: Are you sure you want to delete your profile? This action can not be undone.
HackerProfile.thereIsNoSubmissionToShow: There are no submissions to show
HackerProfile.youHaveNoStats: You have no stats to show. Continue hacking to see something here.
HackerProfile.linkNewAddressToProfile: Link new address to your profile
HackerProfile.linkNewAddressToProfileExplanation: Link another address to your White Hat Profile. This will allow you to show all your submissions and stats on the same profile. INSTRUCTIONS: Step 1: Verify your ownership of the current profile by Signing In With Ethereum Step 2: Open your wallet (e.g., MetaMask) and switch to the account you wish to link. Step 3: Sign In With Ethereum again to verify ownership of the new wallet you are linking.
HackerProfile.linkNewAddressToProfilePartTwoExplanatio:
Now change connected account using your wallet (i.e Metamask) to the one you want to link. 

You will be asked to siwe again with the new wallet you want to link.
HackerProfile.unlinkAddressExplanation: Are you sure you want to unlink this address from your profile?
HackerProfile.cannotUnlinkLastAddress: You can't unlink your last address from your profile.
HackerProfile.streakExplanationDescription:
Build Your Streak with Consistent Engagement


Start Your Streak: Initiate a streak by submitting valid findings.


Reflect Your Dedication: Your streak is a testament to your consistent engagement in the community.


Maintain Your Momentum: Keep your streak alive by submitting at least one valid finding each month.

PGPTool.title: PGP tool
PGPTool.createStrongPasswordForKeystore: Create a strong password for your keystore
PGPTool.createNewKeyPairDescription2: Add alias which will help you identify the key.
PGPTool.importKeyDescription: Import an existing key using your private key.
PGPTool.backupDescription:
Please backup your PGP key-pairs. 

 The backup file will hold all of your keys & passphrases.
PGPTool.restoreBackupDescription: Restore your PGP key-pairs from a backup file.
PGPTool.keyDetailsDescription:
These are the details of your key-pair. 

 Please keep in mind that your private key shouldn't be shared with anyone.
PGPTool.selectPgpKeyDescription:
Select PGP key pair on your keystore. This key will be used for encrypting vulnerability submissions. 

 You can also create keys, import or upload a backup of existing keys.
PGPTool.keyNameAliasPlaceholder: Enter a name or an alias
PGPTool.name: Name
PGPTool.keyAlreadyExists: Key already exists in your keystore
PGPTool.privateKeyHasPassphrase: We've noticed your key is encrypted with a passphrase, please add it to import.
PGPTool.whyABackup: Why do I need a backup?
PGPTool.whyABackupExplanation:
• Your keys are stored on your local browser. In case the cache storage is deleted you can upload the backup. 

 • Use the backup file to move keys between different machines.
PGPTool.youDontHaveKeystore: You don't have a keystore yet
PGPTool.youAreAboutToImportNumKeys: Attention: You are about to import {{numKeys}} valid keys from your backup.
PGPTool.backupDoesNotHaveValidOrNewKeys: This backup does not have any valid or new key to restore.
PGPTool.deleteKeyDescription: Are you sure you want to delete:
PGPTool.whyDoINeedKeys: Why do I need PGP keys?
PGPTool.whyDoINeedKeysExplanation: All submissions are fully encrypted so only the holders of the private PGP keys will be able to decrypt them.
PGPTool.whereAreTheKeysStoredExplanation:
• The Keys are stored on your browser local storage. 

 • Once created, a backup of the keys will available to download.
PGPTool.useKeystoreForSelectCreate: Use the keystore to select/create/import/upload keys and backup.
PGPTool.dontWantToUseOurKeystore: Don't want to use our PGP keystore?
PGPTool.yourKeystoreIsNotBackedUp: Your keystore is not backed up.
PGPTool.dontHaveAccessToKeystore: Don't have access to your keystore?
PGPTool.dontHaveAccessToKeystoreExplanation: If you don't have access to your keystore, you can delete it and create a new one or upload a backup.
PGPTool.deleteKeystoreDescription:
Are you sure you want to delete your keystore? 

 If you don't have a backup of the keys in the keystore you will lose them.

SubmissionsTool.rescanSubmissionsDescription: Are you sure you want to rescan all the submissions, this may take some seconds
SubmissionsTool.createPayoutDescription: You will create a payout for the selected submissions. Are you sure you want to continue?
SubmissionsTool.noSubmissionsFoundForThisDate: No submissions found for that date range
SubmissionsTool.notAllowedToCreatePayout: You are not allowed to create a payout for this vault. Please verify you are connected with a committee wallet.

Leaderboard.ifYouAreAWinner: If you are one of the winners and you want to claim your rewards, please execute the claim by clicking on the button:
Leaderboard.executeReleaseFunction: Execute the `release (0x48b75044)` function with these params:
Leaderboard.needToBeConnectedWithAWinnerAddress: You need to be connected with a winner address
Leaderboard.errorClaimingBounty: You already claimed your bounty or there was an error claiming it.

Payouts.welcomeTitle: Create easy payouts with the payout tool
Payouts.selectVaultToCreatePayout: Select a vault to a create payout
Payouts.connectWithACommitteeMemberWallet: Connect with a committee member wallet to create or see payouts for your Vault.
Payouts.yourWalletIsNotACommittee: Your wallet is not associated with any committee. Please make sure you are connected with the right wallet.
Payouts.createPayoutDescription: Select a vault to create a payout
Payouts.signInToSeePayouts: You need to Sign in with Ethereum in order to see your payouts.
Payouts.signInToSeePayout: You need to Sign in with Ethereum in order to see this payout.
Payouts.noPayoutsInProgress: You have no in progress payouts. You can create a new one by clicking on the button below.
Payouts.fillSplitPayoutInfo: Create a payout to multiple beneficiaries in a single transaction.
Payouts.beneficiaryPlaceholder: Enter the address that will receive the payout
Payouts.reasoningDescription: Provide a clear explanation of the reasons behind your decision to help the submitter understand the classification of the vulnerability.
Payouts.resultDescription: The payout sum and NFT are calculated by the selected severity.
Payouts.anotherActivePayout: You can't create a new payout for this vault while you are creating another one. Please wait for the current payout to finish, or delete it.
Payouts.deletePayoutDescription: Are you sure you want to delete the payout?. This action will permanently delete the payout.
Payouts.deletePayoutConfirmText: Confirm deletion vault name to continue
Payouts.youHaveAlreadySignedThisPayout: You have already signed this payout.
Payouts.youHaveAlredySignedWaitingForOthers: You have already signed this payout. Please wait for the other committee members to sign. Once the minimum signatures are collected you will be able to execute the payout transaction.
Payouts.pleaseSignTheTransaction: Please sign the transaction. Once the minimum signatures are collected you will be able to execute the payout transaction.
Payouts.payoutReadyToExecuteButWaitingForSafetyP: The payout is ready to be executed, but you need to wait for the safety period to starts.
Payouts.safetyPeriodOnYouCanExecutePayout: The safety period is on. You can now execute the payout.
Payouts.yourPayoutIsNotYetCreated: Your payout is not yet created. Please finish the edition and click on 'Create payout'
Payouts.executingPayout: Executing payout (this can take more than usual, do not refresh the page)
Payouts.executePayoutError:
There was an error executing the payout. You can only execute the payout if: 
 - You are connected with a committee wallet. 
 - This vault has no other active claim 
 - The safety period is on.
Payouts.thisVaultHasAnActivePayout: This vault has an active payout on-chain. You can't execute a new payout for this vault until the active one is resolved (approved or dismissed).
Payouts.payoutAllocationExplanation: This is exactly how the 'Total payout sum' amount will be distributed.
Payouts.singlePayoutExplanation: Single payout will allow you to create a payout for a single beneficiary
Payouts.splitPayoutExplanation: Split payout will allow you payout multiple beneficiaries in one transaction
Payouts.uploadCsvExplanation: Upload a payment file on this page using the this CSV template or use this format (beneficiary,severity,percentageToPay). The `percentageToPay` property should be a number between 0 and 100, and the sum of all percentages should be 100.
Payouts.csvDoesNotHaveAnyBeneficiary: The CSV file is badly formatted or does not have any beneficiary to add.
Payouts.fileContainsNumBeneficiaries: File contains {{numBeneficiaries}} beneficiaries to import.
Payouts.percentageToPayExplanation:
What is the % of the total of vault content you would like to payout? 
Percentage can't be higher than the vault max bounty ({{maxBounty}}).
Payouts.editPayoutOfEachBeneficiary:
Edit the payout of each beneficiary. 
Sum of all percentages to pay should be 100%.
Payouts.sumPercentagesPayoutShouldBe100: Sum of percentages of the payout should be 100% (missing {{missingPercentage}}%)
Payouts.generateExplanationDescription:
Generate an explanation template. This will help you to fill the explanation field for each beneficiary. 

Attention: you will lose all the data you have already filled.
Payouts.cantCreatePayoutNoDepositors: You can't create a payout for this vault because it has no deposits.
Payouts.connectedAccountNoPermissionsOnThisPayou: The connected wallet has no permissions to view/edit this payout. Please connect the right wallet.
Payouts.youAreNotACommitteeMemberCantSign: You are not a committee member, you can't sign this payout.
Payouts.percentageOfTheVaultToPay: Percentage of the whole vault to payout

payoutStatusDescriptions.readyToExecute: The needed signatures were collected, you can now execute the payout transaction. Please be aware that the payout can only be executed during safety period.
payoutStatusDescriptions.executed: Your payout was submitted successfully and it's under review. Please wait for the review to finish.
payoutStatusDescriptions.approved: Your payout was approved, the beneficiaries received the payout.

bugBounty.submissionSection:
Your submission will be sent to the committee who will process your submission.

The committee of the vault will respond within 12 hours to acknowledge the receipt of submission via the communication channel you provided.
bugBounty.fixRemedySection:
In order to clarify your submission, the committee might open a direct communication channel with you and ask for one or both of the following:


  • ##question## Questions to help with clarification
  • ##warning## Identification of any errors that they have noticed in your submission


The committee may also request confirmation of the accuracy of your submission and details regarding the solution, which may include the following:


  • ##timeline## Timeline for implementing the solution
  • ##bug## Severity level of the identified vulnerability
  • ##award## Level of reward
bugBounty.awardsSection:
For low-level severity vulnerabilities rewards are likely to be released within 14 days of the validation of your submission.

For medium, high and critical level severity vulnerabilities, rewards will be released within two weeks of the deployment of the vault committee's solution.
bugBounty.alertSection:
Please be aware!

If the vulnerability is exploited prior to the solution being implemented the reward will be voided. As such, please keep all activity in relation to Hats Finance vaults private and confidential.

auditCompetition.submissionSection:
Your submission will be sent to the committee who will process your submission.

Please note that the committee of the vault may or may not respond to acknowledge the receipt of your submission via the Telegram username you provided.

Submission guidelines:

  • Submissions should be made using our Dapp in the on the 'Submit vulnerability' section.
  • You can submit one on-chain submission with multiple issues found on the code.

Submission format:

  • [TITLE]: a short description of the issue
  • [SEVERITY]: the level of severity of the vulnerability found (see the rules)
  • [SEVERITY]: the level of severity of the vulnerability found (see the rules)
  • [DESCRIPTION]: describe the context and the effect of the vulnerability. Also, Describe how the vulnerability can be exploited.
  • [SUPPORT FILES]:
    1. Proof of Concept (PoC): You must provide a file containing a proof of concept (PoC) that demonstrates the vulnerability you have discovered.
    2. Revised Code File (Optional): If possible, please provide a second file containing the revised code that offers a potential fix for the vulnerability. This file should include the following information:
      • Comment with a clear explanation of the proposed fix.
      • The revised code with your suggested changes.
      • Any additional comments or explanations that clarify how the fix addresses the vulnerability.

* Due to the native of the audit competition mechanism, the report will not be encrypted (but yor communication channel will still be encrypted).
auditCompetition.fixRemedySection:
Once the competition ends, the committee members will review your submission and commence the evaluation process. They may start the process earlier than the end of the competition time.

In order to clarify your submission, the committee might open a direct communication channel with you and ask for one or both of the following:


  • ##question## Questions to help with clarification
  • ##warning## Identification of any errors that they have noticed in your submission


The committee may also request confirmation of the accuracy of your submission and details regarding the solution, which may include the following:


  • ##timeline## Timeline for implementing the solution
  • ##bug## Severity level of the identified vulnerability
  • ##award## Level of reward
auditCompetition.awardsSection:
The committee will require approximately 10 days to evaluate all submissions after the end of the competition. Once this evaluation period is complete, the winners will be announced on Hats official Twitter account.

If there are no disputes, winners may claim their rewards between 7-14 days after the announcement of the winner's list. However, in the case of a dispute, the Hats team will inform the winners of any potential delays.

DecryptionTool.welcomeDescription:
The decryption tool allow you to easily decrypt vulnerabilities messages submitted by hackers. 

 In order to decrypt a message you will need to:
DecryptionTool.step1Content: Create a Keystore using a password. Your password will be used to encrypt the storage.
DecryptionTool.step3Content: The encryption works with a private and public keys, where the public key is visible to all people and is used to encrypt messages,the private key should be available only to committee members and allows them to decrypt and read the messages.
DecryptionTool.decryptDescription: Hello @committee member, Generate or import key-pair in order to decrypt.

AirdropPrompt.title: CONGRATS!
AirdropPrompt.text-1: You are eligible to Hats token airdrop machine
AirdropPrompt.text-3: Press continue to view your token eligibility and NFTs

section-1.title: HATS AIRDROP MACHINE
section-1.text:
Welcome to Hats Finance first airdrop machine. 

 The airdrop will go live in the coming months. Now is your chance to check your eligibility and join an Embassy
section-1.tooltip: Embassies are token gated communities for those that have proof of participating in the security of a project.

section-2.title: ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA
section-2.text-1: of the projects who are listed on Hats.
section-2.text-2: who added liquidity to one of the vaults (bug bounty) in Hats dApp.
section-2.text-3: will also be airdropped for their part in creating the community and expanding our reach. We are becoming a big clan!
section-2.text-4: security experts who participate in the Hats game.
section-2.text-5: a collective of experts who tested and helped the dev team from day one. We will forever remember your contribution during the early days of developing our vision and core ideas.

FAQ.answer-1: Every project that hosts a decentral bug bounty will form an embassy. Embassies are token gated communities for those that have proof of participating in the security of a project. The access will be managed by a special NFT that can be earned for contributions. Individuals that are either part of the committee that reviews disclosed exploits or who have deposited into the bug bounty will gain access to their Embassy.
FAQ.answer-2: A security council is a collective of different protocol users such as builders, community members and an array of security experts that contribute to the growth of a project. In our vision, we see a collective of security councils where users who participate in securing protocols are well rewarded for their contributions.
FAQ.question-3: WHEN WILL I RECEIVE MY TOKENS?
FAQ.answer-3: The token will be available only when the Token Generated Event occurs. Please remember that you can receive the token only if you are eligible and hold the NFT.
FAQ.question-4: FOR HOW LONG CAN I REDEEM MY NFT?
FAQ.answer-4: Being part of the embassy will give you different perks in the future, but it's not mandatory to receive the future token airdrop. Please remember that you can receive the token only if you are eligible and hold the NFT.
FAQ.question-5: IF I WON’T JOIN AN EMBASSY CAN I STILL RECEIVE MY FUTURE TOKEN AIRDROP?
FAQ.answer-5: Yes, you can deposit to more than one vault and be part of their embassies.

NFTAirdrop.text-3: Every project that hosts a decentral bug bounty will form an embassy. Embassies are token gated communities for those that have proof of participating in the security of a project. The access will be managed by a special NFT that can be earned for contributions. Individuals that are either part of the committee that reviews disclosed exploits or who have deposited into the bug bounty will gain access to their Embassy.

VaultEditor.pgp-key-hint-tooltip: The encryption works with a private and public PGP keys, where the public key is visible to all people and is used to encrypt messages. The private key should be available only to committee members and allows them to decrypt and read the messages.
